thread.title: Social Security Q&A: Will My C Corp Taxes Increase My Benefit Amount?
thread.title_full: Social Security Q&A: Will My C Corp Taxes Increase My Benefit Amount? - Forbes

author: Laurence Kotlikoff
title: Social Security Q&A: Will My C Corp Taxes Increase My Benefit Amount?
text:
Social Security may be one of your largest assets. What and when you collect will make a huge difference to your lifetime benefits.
Today’s Social Security question is about whether taxes paid as an owner of a C corp will increase Social Security benefits.
Question : I am one of two owners of a C corp . I will retire at the age of 70. Do my partner or I get any Social Security benefit from paying Social Security taxes for the corporation as well as ourselves? We are actually paying once through our individual W2 as well as through the corporation.
Answer : No, the taxes you “pay” via your C corp are really just transmittances of taxes on your earnings that are divided in two by Social Security, with half called the employee contribution and the other called the employer contribution.
My weekly Social Security column appears on PBS NEWSHOUR’s website .
